result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles N Morgan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Charles N Morgan in court, in custody, with attorney Robert J. Penegor.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  The Court strikes the repeater and the Court finds defendant guilty on Count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.     

The defendant was sentenced to the following:  Count #2

COURT COSTS: $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision on Shawano County Case 12CF87).

DNA SURCHARGE:   $250.00, to be paid as a condition of extended supervision on Shawano County Case 12CF87). Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

HUBER: 30 days (consecutive to current case).

The Court denies the Defendant's request for expungement.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
filed, to be produced from Racine Correctional.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-22-2016 09:30 am

Attorney Robert J. Penegor in court.   Defendant Charles N Morgan did not appear.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Penegor requests the Court waive the Defendant's appearance.  The Court waives the Defendant's appearance.    Attorney Penegor requests the Court set the matter for plea and sentencing.  The Court schedules the matter accordingly.   The Court to prepare and OTP and Defendant is to be produced by 1/20/16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Hearing at 12-14-2015 09:30 am
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Charles N Morgan in court, in custody by video from the Racine Correctional Institution, with attorney Robert J. Penegor.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is not able to see the defendant by video but Atty. Penegor agrees to proceed and so does the defendant.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 09:30 am.
